alert.note: Alert for Allen; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Monroe and southeastern Allen Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Scottsville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Monroe and southeastern Allen Counties, including the following locations... Flippin, Emberton, Oak Forest, Freetown, Fountain Run, Gamaliel, Akersville, Holland and Amos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
